Text.Text: Well met.  I am Xavier Torsend, Minister of Foreign Affairs.  How may I serve you?
My duties are limited at the moment due to the war with the Ten-Towns.  Normally I arrange diplomatic functions, negotiate treaties, and issue delegate passes.
A completely senseless affair, in my opinion.  It could have been avoided were it not for those fools from Bryn Shander.
The Mayor, Betran Weaver, and his advisor.  A priest of Helm named Cardaf, if memory serves me right.
When the Legion of the Chimera was first formed, the Lord and Lady asked me to establish diplomatic relations with the neighboring kingdoms.  I decided to start with the Ten-Towns.

I sent envoys to each of the towns asking that we meet and discuss trade agreements, possible alliances, and any other applicable issues.  In every case my envoy was turned away but one....  Bryn Shander said they would reply with an envoy of their own.

Yes.  A tenday later an envoy arrived bearing gifts from Betran Weaver.  The Lord and Lady were presented with the finest cakes and sweets that Bryn Shander had to offer.  They were very pleased.  They decided to honor the envoy with a banquet.
The meal was exquisite, and the wine was magnificent!  The chef outdid herself.  Afterwards, the cakes and sweets were served and that is when the evening turned... sour.

The Lord and Lady are cambions.  That is to say, demon blood flows in their veins.  Well, Betran Weaver apparently knew this and ordered the cakes made with holy water.  When they ate the cakes... they were horribly burned.

They turned upon the envoy and accused him of treachery.  They claimed that he knew the cakes were poison and yet he did not warn them.  They were livid with anger... I thought they were going to slay him.
He is imprisoned here, in one of the towers.  In any case, that is how the war began...
Indeed.  Isair and Madae, formerly of Kuldahar.

How could it not have been?  Why *else* would one bake cakes with holy water?  And not just the cakes, mind you, the sweets were later examined and found tainted as well!  Of *course* it was deliberate, and the Lord and Lady knew this.
No...  No, I think the poor fellow had no idea.  He was just as shocked and outraged as the Lord and Lady.   However, they would not listen to his pleas...

Then you will need to speak with the captain of the guard.  I believe his name is Pudu, but I am not certain.  He can be found in the Officer's Tower, off of the fourth floor.  However, you will need a delegate pass to see him.

Certainly, but there are some restrictions that you must be aware of.  One, you must carry your pass at all times.  Two, visitors are not allowed beyond the second floor without a pass.  Three, the guards reserve the right to deny access to any area, even if you have a pass.  Do you understand these restrictions?
Very well.  Then I will need you to fill out this form... and this one...  Good.  Now sign here... and here... and here.  Yes...  Everything seems in order, here is your pass.
I am happy to serve you.  Will there be anything else?
It is an unfortunate necessity of war.  It is a guard and is there to prevent intruders from compromising the Severed Hand.  If the creature offends you, please accept my apology.
Slaves...  Forgive me, but there are no slaves at the severed hand...  Ah, perhaps you mean the conscripted workers?

Yes.  In times of war it is not unusual for some of the citizenry to be conscripted into military service.  In this instance they were delegated to the repair of this fortress.  It is a common practice.
I can assure you that you are in error.  Why, just the thought of that is obscene and barbaric.  Who, may I ask, put these ideas into your head?
I...  That is to say...  I have never spoken with the workers.  I was told they were conscripts and that they should be left to their work...  Slaves, you say?
I...  That is to say...  I have never spoken with the workers, nor will I speak to that creature.  I was told they were conscripts and that they should be left to their work...  Slaves you say?
If I may have a moment of you time, I will speak to Jerre myself.
I do not know what to say.  I spoke with Jerre Stoh myself.  It seems that you are correct and the workers are indeed slaves.  This situation is intolerable!

I will resign my position as minister.  I am certain that my services are needed elsewhere in the realms...  Before I leave, I will give you this.  It is a delegate pass.  You will find it useful.  Farewell.
I will resign my position as minister.  I am certain that my services are needed elsewhere in the realms...  Farewell.
We meet again.  How may I serve you?
I am Xavier Torsend, Minister of Foreign Affairs.  May I assist you with something?

Perhaps, but not necessarily in this case.  Isair and Madae are cambions.  That is to say, demon blood flows in their veins.  For all I know, the creature may be a relative of theirs.  In any case, it is not my place, nor yours, to question.
Oh?  How so?  Explain yourself.
Let us change the subject.  Is there anything else that I may assist you with?
Audiences with the Lord and Lady are reserved for visiting dignitaries.  May I ask which nation or province you represent?
The Ten-Towns...  I see.  May I ask why you are here then?  Do you wish to sue for peace?  Or perhaps you wish to lay down your arms and surrender?
Well, that certainly sounds ominous.  Am I to construe that as a threat against the Lord and Lady?
I see...  Well, I can add your name to their calendar, but you should know that they are away on official business right now.
I do not know.  I have not been made privy to their exact whereabouts.  They are less forthcoming with information, what with the war and all.
Uh...  How quaintly put... but yes, it did light the fires so to say.
I am a politician, friend.  I do not consider myself to be a fool.
I do not consider myself to be naive...  I just get lost in my work and fail to notice...  Never mind.  If I may have a moment of your time, I will speak to Jerre myself.
What do you do here?
I must take my leave of you.  Farewell.
What can you tell me about the war?
Could you arrange an audience with Isair and Madae?
I am curious.  Do you know anything about the demon in the hall?
I have been informed that I need a delegate pass.  Can you help me?
I must take my leave of you.  Farewell.
What fools?
What fools?
What did they do?
What did they do?
Ah, politicians.  I should have known.
Go on.
The Lord and Lady that you speak of.  Do you mean Isair and Madae?
Did they do so?
Go on.
What happened?
What did they do?
That must have lit a fire under their ass.
So it was deliberate?
What was his fate?
Do you believe him guilty?
I would like to see the envoy.
I would like to see the envoy.
I am curious.  Do you know anything about the demon in the hall?
I have been informed that I need a delegate pass.  Can you help me?
I must take my leave of you.  Farewell.
I see.  Go on with your story.
I see.  Go on with your story.  What did they do?
What was his fate?
Can you give me a delegate pass?
I have the pass that you gave me.  I am grateful, Xavier.
Yes, I understand them.
I am grateful.
I am curious.  Do you know anything about the demon in the hall?
I must take my leave of you.  Farewell.
What can you tell me about the war?
A demon as a guard?  Is that not a bit unorthodox?
It is my understanding that it keeps the slaves from escaping.
Conscripted workers?
No, I mean the slaves.  The people that are performing the repairs.
Xavier, these people are slaves.  The demon is there to keep them from escaping.  If they try, they are slain.
I spoke with Jerre Stoh, the slave foreman.
I spoke with Jerre Stoh, the slave foreman.  I then spoke with the creature itself, and it confirmed it.
Yes.  Ask them yourself, Xavier.
How can you be the Minister of Foreign Affairs, yet be so naive.  Yes, they are slaves.  Ask them yourself, Xavier.
Yes.  Ask them yourself, Xavier.
How can you be the Minister of Foreign Affairs, yet be so naive.  Yes, they are slaves.  Ask them yourself, Xavier.
Certainly.
What do you intend to do?
What do you intend to do?
Farewell, Xavier.
Farewell, Xavier.
Who are you again?
Could you arrange an audience with Isair and Madae?
I am curious.  Do you know anything about the demon in the hall?
I have been informed that I need a delegate pass.  Can you help me?
I must take my leave of you.  Farewell.
What do you do here?
I must take my leave of you.  Farewell.
In this instance you are wrong, Xavier.
Perhaps you are right, Xavier.
It is my understanding that it keeps the slaves from escaping.
You mentioned the war.  What can you tell me about it?
I have been informed that I need a delegate pass.  Can you help me?
I must take my leave of you.  Farewell.
The Ten-Towns.
I think it safe to say that I represent my own interests.
I am here to end this war.
Surrender?  I think not.  There are other ways to end this war.
Not at all, Xavier.
Yes, you should.  I intend to slay them.  Oh, and you as well while I am at it.  Die!
Where are they?
What can you tell me about the war?
I am curious.  Do you know anything about the demon in the hall?
I have been informed that I need a delegate pass.  Can you help me?
I must take my leave of you.  Farewell.
What did they do?
So it was deliberate?
Well, there are exceptions to every rule, Xavier.  Go on with your story.  What did they do?
Certainly.
